revised_title: Observations on the Effects of Touch and Friction in Medicine
tldr: The author discusses various observations and examples of the effects of touch and friction in medicine, including the use of dead hands for treating wens and tumors, and the role of touch in alleviating pain and restoring the use of limbs. They also mention the potential for friction and touch to influence the spirits and invigorate the body. The author cites examples of successful treatments using touch and friction, such as a knight whose pain in his feet was relieved by a dog licking them, and a blacksmith who had a healing touch and could cure ailments by stroking affected areas.
